record.title: JOINT MEETING OF THE TWO HOUSES--ADDRESS BY THE PRESIDENT OF THE REPUBLIC OF FRANCE
record.narrative:
JOINT MEETING OF THE TWO HOUSES--ADDRESS BY THE PRESIDENT OF THE REPUBLIC OF FRANCE -- (Senate - November 07, 2007)

[Page: S14025]

speaking.paragraph: Mr. President, I ask unanimous consent that the Senate recess subject to the call of the Chair, as indicated in the previous unanimous consent agreement.

record.narrative: There being no objection, the Senate, at 10:35 a.m., recessed, subject to the call of the Chair, and the Senate, preceded by the Secretary of the Senate, Nancy Erickson, and the Deputy Sergeant at Arms, Drew Willison, proceeded to the Hall of the House of Representatives to hear the address of the President of the Republic of France, Nicolas Sarkozy.
(The address delivered by the President of the Republic of France to a joint meeting of the two Houses of Congress is printed in the Proceedings of the House of Representatives in today's Record.)
Thereupon, at 12:23 p.m., the Senate, having returned to its Chamber, reassembled and was called to order by the Presiding Officer (Mr. Menendez).
